summary.para: Gets a value that specifies how the ends of each dash are drawn.

returns.para: A value that specifies how the ends of each dash are drawn.

summary.para: Copies the dash pattern to the specified array.

param.name: dashes
param.para: A pointer to an array that will receive the dash pattern. The array must be able to contain at least as many elements as specified by dashesCount. You must allocate storage for this array.

param.name: dashesCount
param.para: The number of dashes to copy. If this value is less than the number of dashes in the stroke style's dashes array, the returned dashes are truncated to dashesCount. If this value is greater than the number of dashes in the stroke style's dashes array, the extra dashes are set to 0.0f. To obtain the actual number of dashes in the stroke style's dashes array, use the method.

remarks.para: The dashes are specified in units that are a multiple of the stroke width, with subsequent members of the array indicating the dashes and gaps between dashes: the first entry indicates a filled dash, the second a gap, and so on.

summary.para: Retrieves the number of entries in the dashes array.

returns.para: The number of entries in the dashes array if the stroke is dashed; otherwise, 0.

summary.para: Retrieves a value that specifies how far in the dash sequence the stroke will start.

returns.para: A value that specifies how far in the dash sequence the stroke will start.

summary.para: Gets a value that describes the stroke's dash pattern.

returns.para: A value that describes the predefined dash pattern used, or if a custom dash style is used.

remarks.para: If a custom dash style is specified, the dash pattern is described by the dashes array, which can be retrieved by calling the method.

summary.para: Retrieves the type of shape used at the end of a stroke.

returns.para: The type of shape used at the end of a stroke.

summary.para: Retrieves the type of joint used at the vertices of a shape's outline.

returns.para: A value that specifies the type of joint used at the vertices of a shape's outline.

summary.para: Retrieves the limit on the ratio of the miter length to half the stroke's thickness.

returns.para: A positive number greater than or equal to 1.0f that describes the limit on the ratio of the miter length to half the stroke's thickness.

summary.para: Retrieves the type of shape used at the beginning of a stroke.

returns.para: The type of shape used at the beginning of a stroke.

summary.para: Describes the caps, miter limit, line join, and dash information for a stroke.

remarks.para: To create a stroke style, use the ID2D1Factory.CreateStrokeStyle method.
A stroke style is a device-independent resource; you can create it once then retain it for the life of your application. For more information about resources, see the Resources Overview.
